posts.message:
Hello every one,
I was working on an angularJS, IONIC project with CI backend
I was sending parameters to server using POST Method. and receive it using codeIgniter Input class. and everything was working OK.

Now that app gonna be native Android and the developer should send parameters as JSON array, so i changed my backend API function to receive it like:

$data = json_decode(file_get_contents('php://input'), true);
$email = $data->email;

It works great but the problem now when i try to access the function using IONIC app I get an php error.
 
I'm searching around that and found a solution to post parameters as json array but it gives me an error:

XMLHttpRequest cannot load http://192.168.1.122/project/index.php/api/login. Request header field Content-Type is not allowed by Access-Control-Allow-Headers.

on my API I allowed all CORS

header('Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *');
header('Access-Control-Allow-Methods: POST, GET, OPTIONS, DELETE, PUT');

but still get the same error.

can i get any other solution around that point.
thanks for your help.

I think I have hit every Rails Application that implements #omniauth with something cool, Guys everyone uses omniauth 1.2.2 or previous versions Update your omniauth code as soon the patch will be live.

A great "map" for anyone who wants to start a career in Web Development/Design.
It covers both the Front-End and Back-End tracks plus some shared areas between the two.
It has links to learn most things mentioned in it.
And here's a youtube video explaining it in detail if you're not sure what you're looking at:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pB0WvcxTbCA

posts.message: Don't hesitate to say that the today's fiction is a future reality !

posts.description: Often times, we look at the technology in science fiction as something we'd love to have someday, but as it turns out, a lot of them have actually come into our lives, just in a slightly different form. Remember the communicator from Star Trek? That's here. How about Iron Man's suit? Believe it or n…
